{{Multiple issues| {{one source|date=January 2011}} {{more footnotes|date=December 2010}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2011}} }}
{{Infobox person | name = Kirill Albertovich Kravchenko | image = Kirill_Kravchenko_image_NIS.jpg | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1976|05|13}} | birth_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] <!-- | company = JSC [[Gazprom Neft]]--> | education = [[Lomonosov Moscow State University]] }} '''Kravchenko, Kirill Albertovich''' (born May 13, 1976 in [[Moscow]]) is Deputy Director General in charge of Administrative Affairs [[Gazprom Neft]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.gazprom-neft.com/company/management/management.php |title=Management Board of JSC Gazprom neft |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120116044716/http://www.gazprom-neft.com/company/management/management.php |archivedate=2012-01-16 |df= }}</ref> Within Gazprom Neft is responsible to managing the organizational issues block, and for implementing several start-up projects of the company, for Operational Management System (OMS Etalon) and company safety. He is in charge of the introduction of "Digitization", a process that is implemented at the level of "Gazprom" group.
==Education== *1993-1998 [[Lomonosov Moscow State University]] (Sociology) *1998-2001 [[Lomonosov Moscow State University]] (PhD in Sociology) *2002-2003 [[The Open University]] (UK) (Financial Management) *2003-2004 [[International Institute for Management Development|IMD Business School]] (Management) *2004-2006 [http://www.muctr.ru/en/index.php Mendeleev D.I. Russian University of Chemical Technology] (PhD in Economics)
==Career== *Until 2000-work in consulting sphere *2000-2004-[[:ru:ЮКОС|YUKOS]] in various positions in Moscow and Western Siberia *2001-2002-work in Europe and Latin America in the company [[Schlumberger]] (partnership program with the oil company YUKOS) *2004-2007-Administrative Director of [http://www.eurochem.ru/ JSC MKHK EuroChim], Chairman of the Board of Directors of the "[http://www.lifosa.com/ Lifosa]" company *In April 2007-appointed Deputy CEO, Foreign Asset Management of [http://www.gazprom-neft.com/ Gazprom Neft] *From February 2009-Deputy Director General of [[Gazprom Neft]] on Foreign Asset Management *2009-2017-General director of Oil Industry of Serbia [[Naftna industrija Srbije|Oil industry of Serbia (NIS)]] *2009-2018-Member of the Board of Directors of Oil Industry of Serbia [[Naftna industrija Srbije|Oil industry of Serbia (NIS)]] *From July 2017-Deputy General Director of Gazprom neft for Administrative Affairs *From 2017-President of Board of Directors of OOO ITSK
==Awards== *Golden medal of the Republic of Serbia for merits in strengthening cultural and economic ties between Serbia and Russia 2017 *St. Sava medal, the highest merit of the Serbian Orthodox Church for the contribution to the development of Russian-Serbian relations and the preservation of tradition and culture 2017 *National Business Award "Captains of Russian Business" 2010 in the "CEO" nomination *Award Corporate Men of the Year by the magazine "[https://sr-rs.facebook.com/TheMenMagazine The Men]" for socially responsible business operation in 2010, most influent investment in 2011, most influent strateg in 2012 *Award Kapetan [[Miša Anastasijević]] for strategic management in 2011 and 2012 *Commendation Honorary Citizen of [[Pančevo]] given for special contribution to the town of Pančevo *Award "Cooperation and extraordinary contribution" - Security - informative agency of Republic of Serbia *The most influent foreigner in Serbia in 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015 by expert jury of Serbian edition of daily papers of Ringier Axel Springer.
==Additional Information== * Professor of [http://www.muctr.ru/en/ Mendeleev D.I. Russian University of Chemical Technology], [[Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas]], [[University of Novi Sad]] (Serbia), Teaches at [https://web.archive.org/web/20150321222004/http://www.insead.edu/home/ INSEAD] - International business school and IEDC school at Bled in Slovenia, more than 100 books and scientific publications. He is a member of Association of independent directors in Russian Federation [http://www.nand.ru]
Over the years, Kirill Kravchenko was elected to the board of directors of major Russian and foreign companies ([http://www.slavneft.ru/ USC Slavneft], [http://www.rosneft.com/Upstream/ProductionAndDevelopment/western_siberia/tomskneft/ JSC Tomskneft], [http://www.lifosa.com/ Lifosa company], [http://itscgroup.org/ ITSC Construction Company],[http://www.em-alliance.ru/company/head/sovet-direktorov/georgios/ EmAlliance]
==Bibliography== *Organizational Design and Development Management of Major Companies. K.A.Kravchenko, V.P. Meshalkin-M: [http://www.aprogect.ru/ Akademichesky proekt], 2006 - p. 531 *Organizational Construction and Personnel Management of a Major Company - M: [http://www.aprogect.ru/ Akademichesky proekt], 2005.-p. 636 *Guidance on Corporat Governance for Chairmen and Directors. Ed.A.A.Filatov, K.A.Kravchenko-M:[http://www.alpina.ru/ Alpina Business Book], 2006.-p. 431 *Modern Practice of Corporate Governance in Russian Companies. Ed. A.A.Filatov, K.A. Kravchenko-M:[http://www.alpina.ru/ Alpina Business Book], 2007.-p. 244 *Corporate Governance and Work of Board of Directors in Russian Companies. Ed. A.A. Filatov, K.A. Kravchenko-M: [http://www.alpina.ru/ Alpina Business Book], 2007.-p. 244 *Major Company Management. K.A. Kravchenko, V.P. Meshalkin-M: [http://www.aprogect.ru/ Akademichesky proekt], 2010.-p. 351 *CEO School-Insights from 20 Global Business Leaders. S.V.Shekshnya, K.A.Kravchenko, E.Williams: [http://www.nedeljnik.rs/velike-price/portalnews/a-leader-has-to-be-curious-to-get-the-best-outcome-from-every-moment-mr-kiril-kravchenko-on-what-it-means-to-be-a-great-ceo], [https://www.palgrave.com/la/book/9789811078644 Palgrave Pivot] [https://www.palgrave.com/us/palgrave-pivot], 2018
== References == {{reflist}} * [http://www.gubkin.ru/wps/wcm/connect/gubkin_prof/st-prof/sa-prof/sa-prof-out-of-state/ct-prof-kravchyenko-k-a Kirill Kravchenko profile on Gubkin Russian State University for Oil and Gas] *[http://www.dissercat.com/content/sotsialno-ekonomicheskie-osnovy-planirovaniya-personala%20Social%20and%20economic%20basis%20of%20personell%20planning%5D Dissertation - Social and economic basis of personnel planning] *[http://www.dissercat.com/content/metodologicheskie-osnovy-protsessno-strukturnogo-podkhoda-k-proektirovaniyu-i-razvitiyu-vyso Dissertation at Russian Chemical -technical University Mendeleev ] *[http://www.re-serve.ru/people/?srchPat%5B20%5D=1&srchPat%5B20%5D=1&curPos=48 Included in personnel reserve of Russian Federation President's administration] *[http://hbr-russia.ru/liderstvo/lidery/777373 Harvard Business Review Russia: article on the occasion published "CEO school" <nowiki>]</nowiki>]
==External links== *[http://www.focus-fen.net/?id=f2529 Kirill Kravchenko, Gazprom Neft: Perspectives before energy sources market in Southeast Europe are not bad, Interview with Focus agency] * [http://www.b92.net/biz/fokus/intervju.php?yyyy=2012&mm=12&nav_id=670620 Kravchenko about NIS, dividends, Serbia] * [http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/04/22/serbia-nis-idUKL5N0D92BJ20130422 Serbia's oil firm NIS aims to expand, EU can help -CEO] * [http://www.euractiv.com/energy/nis-ceo-gazprom-main-shareholder-interview-518891 Gazprom is our main shareholder, but we support Serbia’s EU bid] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130514021837/http://www.nis.rs/prescentar/vesti/inervju-kiril-kravcenko-madjarski-figyelo?lang=en Interview of CEO of NIS Kiril Kravchenko for Hungarian magazine ''Figyelo''] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20131111115627/http://www.nis.rs/prescentar/vesti/intervju-generalni-direktor-dojce-vele?lang=en Interview of CEO Kirill Kravchenko for Deutche Welle] *[http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/1594545 Info in Kommersant] * [http://izvestia.ru/news/591754 Interview of CEO of NIS Kirill Kravchenko for Russian "Izvestiya"] * [http://www.nedeljnik.rs/velike-price/portalnews/a-leader-has-to-be-curious-to-get-the-best-outcome-from-every-moment-mr-kiril-kravchenko-on-what-it-means-to-be-a-great-ceo Interview of dr Kirill Kravchenko for specialized website of the Serbian magazine "Nedeljnik"]

{{Infobox person | name = Komeil Bahmanpour
کمیل بهمن‌پور | image = Komeil Bahmanpour IKA June 2009.jpg | imagesize = 255px | caption = Komeil Bahmanpour at the [[Tehran Imam Khomeini International Airport|IKA]] in [[Tehran]], June 2009 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1978|1|28}} | birth_place = [[Tehran]], [[Iran]] | occupation = President of Chortkeh, author | networth = | spouse = | children = | residence = | nationality = {{flagicon|IRN}} [[Iranian people|Iranian]] | nicknames = | alma_mater = | website = [http://www.komeil.com/ Komeil.com] | awards = Best World/Farsi Editor, 2004 [[Open Directory Project|ODP]] Autumn Editor Awards | known_for = Co-founding Chortkeh, managing Persian [[Open Directory Project|ODP]], contributing to the [[Unicode]] Standard | years_active= 1992–present | signature = | footnotes = }} '''Komeil Bahmanpour''' (born January 28, 1978) is an [[Iran]]ian entrepreneur, software architect and author. He is a co-founder and the president of Chortkeh.{{cite web | title = Chortkeh Rescheduled Product Releases Due To Iranian Protests | publisher = eForms News | date = July 12, 2009 | url = http://www.eformsnews.com/2009/07/chortkeh-rescheduled-product-releases.html | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} == Early life and education == Komeil Bahmanpour was born and raised in [[Tehran]], Iran. Thanks to his father being an influential banker, he grew up learning about [[IBM mainframe]]s at [[Tejarat Bank]] Bureau of Informatics. Starting his profession as a teenager in 1992, he studied [[computer programming]] in [[Iran University of Science and Technology|IUST]] and obtained his IBM mainframe [[Assembly language|Assembly]] programming license. He has also studied [[software engineering]] at [[Islamic Azad University|Azad South Tehran University of Technology]].{{cite web | title = An Interview with Komeil Bahmanpour: The Brains behind Chortkeh | publisher = eForms News | date = July 9, 2002 | url = http://www.eformsnews.com/2002/07/komeil-bahmanpour-chortkeh-interview.html | accessdate = January 23, 2013 }} == Career == In 1999, Komeil Bahmanpour was introduced to an [[United States|American]] eforms software company willing to open overseas subsidiaries for the purpose of [[Middle East]]ern software development and marketing. The deal went on and Chortkeh ({{lang-fa|چرتکه}})—back then doing business as ''Chortkeh Rayaneh Hamrah, LLC'' ({{lang-fa|چرتکه رایانه همراه، شرکت با مسئولیت محدود}})—was established. === Chortkeh === He was assigned as the chief [[software architecture|software architect]] also managing development teams working on projects in different fields such as [[Document conversion|eforms conversion]], [[virtual printer]], [[object recognition]], [[barcode]], etc. === Persian Open Directory Project === Since 2003, Komeil Bahmanpour has been the managing editor of [[Netscape]]'s [[Persian language|Persian]] [[Open Directory Project|ODP]],{{cite web | title = Profile - komeil | publisher = [[Open Directory Project]] | url = http://www.dmoz.org/public/profile?editor=komeil | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} still maintaining its Persian [[Web portal|portal]] at [http://www.dmoz.ir/ Dmoz.ir].{{cite web | title = Persian Open Directory Project | publisher = Chortkeh | language = Persian | url = http://www.dmoz.ir/ | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} He won the Best World/Farsi Editor at the 2004 ODP Autumn Editor Awards.{{cite web | title = Best World/Farsi Editor, 2004 Autumn Editor Awards | publisher = [[Open Directory Project]] | url = http://www.dmoz.org/img/mozzies/2004/2004_Autumn_farsi_W.gif | format = GIF | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} As the Persian ODP managing editor, Bahmanpour was behind a big decision to change the [[Uniform Resource Locator|URL]] of the Persian ODP from [http://www.dmoz.org/World/Farsi/ Dmoz.org/World/Farsi/] into [http://www.dmoz.org/World/Persian/ Dmoz.org/World/Persian/].{{cite web | title = Google Directory Updated after 5-Month Delay in the Long Run, Unchanged for a Year and a Half | author = Komeil Bahmanpour | publisher = Komeil Bahmanpour | url = http://www.komeil.com/blog/google-directory-updated-delay-dmoz-rdf | date = August 18, 2007 | accessdate = March 27, 2011 }} Believing in the fact that employing ''Farsi'' instead of ''Persian'' across the [[English language|English]] [[World Wide Web|Web]] is [[Betrayal|betraying]] Persian language,{{cite web | title = Employing Farsi Instead of Persian; an Unintentional Betrayal | publisher = Lost 4 Words | language = Persian | url = http://www.salehoffline.com/archives/001916.html | date = April 15, 2006 | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} during a month-long discussion between him and the ODP meta editors, he persisted on replacing the [[Transliteration|transliterated]] word ''Farsi'' with the more adequate word ''Persian'', but metas on the other hand precluded the change based on the assumption that URLs have been promoted for years, so it will not be a wise choice to change them. Eventually, in March 2007 the URL was changed.{{cite web | title = Open Directory - World: Persian | publisher = [[Internet Archive#Wayback Machine|Internet Archive: Wayback Machine]] | url = http://dmoz.org/World/Persian/ | date = March 4, 2007 | accessdate = August 22, 2009 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070304210751/http://dmoz.org/World/Persian/ | archivedate = March 4, 2007}} === Unicode contribution === [[Multilingual software]] and [[font]]s have always been his main interests. He has contributed to the development of the [[Unicode]] Standard,{{cite web | title = Write Persian Appropriately! | publisher = JameJam Newspaper | url = http://www.jamejamonline.ir/Papertext.aspx?newsnum=100883769511 | language = Persian | date = August 22, 2010 | accessdate = March 27, 2011 }} especially in [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[Persian language|Persian]] and [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]] languages.{{cite web | title = Chortkeh Satisfied with the Office InfoPath Research and Development Program | publisher = eForms News | date = November 5, 2003 | url = http://www.eformsnews.com/2003/11/chortkeh-satisfied-with-office-infopath.html | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} He also authored Chortkeh Font Toolbox, a [[font management software]] suite comprising the [[freeware]]{{cite web | title = Chortkeh BDF Font Viewer 2.0 | publisher = [[CNET]] | date = August 14, 2009 | url = http://download.cnet.com/Chortkeh-BDF-Font-Viewer/3000-2316_4-10965410.html | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} Chortkeh BDF Font Viewer{{cite web | title = Font Managers | author = [[Luc Devroye]] | publisher = [[McGill University School of Computer Science]] | url = http://luc.devroye.org/fontmanagers.html | accessdate = March 27, 2011 }}{{cite web | title = Download Chortkeh BDF Font Viewer 2.0 | author = | publisher = [[Yahoo!]] Downloads | url = http://downloads.yahoo.com/software/windows-knick-knacks-chortkeh-bdf-font-viewer-s45107 | accessdate = January 23, 2013 }} since January 19, 2002.{{cite web | title = Chortkeh BDF Font Viewer 1.1 | author = Komeil Bahmanpour | publisher = Komeil Bahmanpour | date = January 19, 2002 | url = http://www.komeil.com/blog/chortkeh-bdf-font-viewer-1-1 | accessdate = August 22, 2009 }} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.komeil.com/ The Official Website of Komeil Bahmanpour] * [http://www.komeil.com/blog Weblog of Komeil Bahmanpour] * [http://www.chortkeh.com/ Website of Chortkeh] * [http://www.dmoz.ir/ Persian Open Directory Project] {{DEFAULTSORT:Bahmanpour, Komeil}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iranian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Tehran]] [[Category:Islamic Azad University alumni]] [[Category:Iranian computer programmers]]

{{Infobox scientist | name = Manfred Fuchs | birth_date = {{Birth date|1938|7|25}} | birth_place = [[Latsch]], Italy | residence = | nationality = [[Germany]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2014|4|26|1938|7|25}} | death_place = [[Kaltern an der Weinstraße]], Italy | fields = | workplaces = Founder of the German space company [[OHB System|OHB]] | alma_mater = | academic_advisors = | doctoral_students = | website = }} '''Manfred Fuchs''' (July 25 1938 in [[Latsch]], Italy – April 26 2014 in [[Kaltern an der Weinstraße]]) was a German entrepreneur and space pioneer who was the founder of the German space company [[OHB System|OHB]].
==Life== Fuchs' family owned distilleries in South Tyrol, the brewery forest near Merano, which is still family-owned, also sawmills and wine trade; Moreover, his father owned a trucking company and a restaurant. He attended trade school in Bolzano, studied in Munich at the Technical College and from 1957 in Hamburg at the Engineering School. He was a graduate engineer for aerospace engineering and development engineer at Hamburger Flugzeugbau, where he started after graduating in 1959. From 1961 Fuchs worked in Bremen at the aerospace company ERNO, an EADS predecessor. There he was in 1965 a group leader, head of department (Astro Dynamics / Preliminary Development) and department head (Director Department 1982). In 1981, he received full power of attorney. He was involved in the [[Ariane (rocket family)|Ariane-1]], [[Columbus (ISS module)|Columbus]] and [[Spacelab]] projects.
In 1981 he participated with his wife Christa, who initially held the shares, at the [[OHB System|Otto Hydraulic Bremen]] (OHB) in Hemelinger port. OHB was at that time a small company for hydraulic and electrical works with five employees and worked mainly for the Bundeswehr. In 1985 he took over after leaving the ERNO the company OHB completely. Fuchs built the OHB from a company for satellite technology and aviation technology. Initially, the company also produced parts for the [[Airbus A380]]. In 2009, the company had about 1,600 employees and is based in Technology Park at the [[University of Bremen]]. The company supplied reconnaissance satellites for the German [[Bundeswehr]], including the [[SAR-Lupe]] system and satellite data for the [[Frontex]]. The turnover amounted to 320 million Euros and then OHB 2009 was the third largest European aerospace group EADS and after the [[Thales Group]]. OHB stands since 2000 for high-technology Bremen orbitals. Manfred Fuchs served there as chairman.<ref>[https://www.ohb-system.de/aufsichtsrat.html OHB Official website]</ref> The company was located in 2009 to 70 % in family possession of the Fuchs family, but was listed.
In 2010 the company was awarded the contract for the construction of satellites for the [[Galileo (satellite navigation)|Galileo]] project, a European [[Global Positioning System|GPS]] system and the contract for the European [[Meteosat]] project. The subsidiary MT Aerospace in Augsburg the Fuchs Group is the largest German supplier for the Ariane rocket.
== Awards and Tributes == * 1995: Bremer Entrepreneur of the Year * 1996: Honorary Professor of the [[Bremen University of Applied Sciences]] * 2005: Honorary Doctor of the [[Polytechnic University of Milan]] * 2009: Honorary citizen and supporter of the [[University of Bremen]] * 2011: [[Werner von Siemens Ring]] * 2014: [[Manfred Memorial Moon Mission]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [https://www.ohb-system.de/supervisory-board.html Official OHB Website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Fuchs, Manfred}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:2014 deaths]] [[Category:German businesspeople]] [[Category:People from South Tyrol]] [[Category:Werner von Siemens Ring laureates]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Spanish name|Boyer|Salvador}} {{Infobox Minister | name = Miguel Boyer | image = Miguel Boyer en el Congreso de los Diputados (1983).jpg | imagesize = | caption = Miguel Boyer in 1983 | office = Minister of Economy, Treasury and Commerce | primeminister = [[Felipe González]] | predecessor = | successor = [[Carlos Solchaga Catalan|Carlos Solchaga Catalán]] | term_start =1 December 1982 | term_end = 6 July 1985 | birth_date = 5 February 1939 | birth_place = [[St. Jean de Luz]], France | death_date = {{death date and age|2014|9|29|1939|2|5|df=y}} | death_place = [[Madrid]], Spain | restingplace = | party =[[Socialist Party (Spain)|Socialist Party]] | residence = | alma_mater = [[Complutense University of Madrid]] | spouse = {{marriage|[[Elena Arnedo]]
|1964|1985|end=div}}
{{marriage|[[Isabel Preysler]]
|1987}} | nationality = [[Spanish people|Spanish]] | religion= | children = 4 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Miguel Boyer Salvador''' (5 February 1939 – 29 September 2014) was a Spanish economist and politician, who served as minister of economy, treasury and commerce from 1982 to 1985. ==Early life and education== Boyer was born in [[St. Jean de Luz]], [[France]], on 5 February 1939.{{cite book|author1=Eamonn J. Rodgers|author2=Valerie Rodgers|title=Encyclopedia of Contemporary Spanish Culture|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ymIXLhegGnwC&pg=PR18|accessdate=8 July 2013|year=1999|publisher=CRC Press|isbn=978-0-415-13187-2|page=62}} He was a graduate of [[Universidad Complutense de Madrid|the Universidad Complutense de Madrid]] where he studied economics.{{cite news|title=José Luis Sampedro: Economist who became an inspiration for Spain's anti-austerity movement|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/jos-luis-sampedro-economist-who-became-an-inspiration-for-spains-antiausterity-movement-8636614.html|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=The Independent|date=29 May 2013}} He also received a degree in physics from the same university. ==Career== Boyer worked at different banks and institutions. He served as the director of planning for Union Explosivos Rio Tinto and later as a senior economist at [[Bank of Spain|the Bank of Spain]].{{cite news|title=Spain's pragmatic socialism finds management types in key posts|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/1983/1014/101428.html/(page)/2|accessdate=8 July 2013|work=The CS Monitor|date=14 October 1983}} He became the deputy director of the national industrial institute and then the director of the institute in 1974. He was one of the Ibercorp shareholders. He joined [[Socialist Party (Spain)|the Socialist Party]] as part of its social democrat wing in 1960.{{cite news|author=James M. Markham|title=Spain's new leader outlines cautious plans to parliament|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1982/12/01/world/spain-s-new-leader-outlines-cautious-plans-to-parliament.html|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=1 December 1982}} He helped [[Felipe González]] to form a faction in the party in the mid-1970s.{{cite book|title=A Dictionary of Political Biography|year=1998|publisher=OUP|location=Oxford|page=191|url=https://www.questia.com/read/34683590/a-dictionary-of-political-biography|author=Dennis Kavanagh|accessdate=4 September 2013|chapter=González Márquez, Felipe}} {{Subscription required|via=Questia}} Boyer was a member of the [[Congress of Deputies (Spain)|Spanish Congress of Deputies]], representing [[Jaen (Spanish Congress Electoral District)|Jaén Province]], and economic spokesperson of the party.{{cite news|title=Euphoria turns to moderation as Spain's Socialists face reality of power|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/1982/1101/110151.html/(page)/3|accessdate=8 July 2013|work=The CS Monitor|date=1 November 1982}} He and [[Carlos Solchaga Catalan|Carlos Solchaga]] were the architects of the party's economy policy. Boyer was appointed minister of economy, treasury and commerce to the first cabinet of Felipe González on 2 December 1982.{{cite book|author=Omar G. Encarnación|title=Spanish Politics: Democracy After Dictatorship|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=F1wWKJVaZeIC&pg=PA115|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=8 July 2008|publisher=Polity|isbn=978-0-7456-3992-5|page=115}}{{cite book|author1=Jorge Martínez-Vázquez|author2=José Félix Sanz|title=Fiscal Reform in Spain: Accomplishments and Challenges|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9IczeZDLtHwC&pg=PA34|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=1 January 2007|publisher=Edward Elgar Publishing|isbn=978-1-78254-271-1|page=34}} In 1985, he developed a tax act that enabled people to avoid tax on saving interest if they invested in insurance accounts.{{cite book|author=John Gibbons|title=Spanish Politics Today|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=z3VZju64kjMC&pg=PA140|accessdate=8 July 2013|year=1999|publisher=Manchester University Press|isbn=978-0-7190-4946-0|page=140}} During his term he was regarded as the most powerful member of the cabinet.{{cite news|title=Spanish Premier Airs Out Cabinet, Replaces 6|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1985-07-05/news/8502130395_1_cabinet-portfolio-territorial-administration-socialist-legislator|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=Chicago Tribune|date=5 July 1985|location=Madrid}} However, in a cabinet reshuffle in July 1985 Boyer was removed from office and was succeeded by [[Carlos Solchaga Catalan|Carlos Solchaga]] in the post.{{cite book|author=John Gillingham|title=European Integration, 1950-2003: Superstate Or New Market Economy?|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tKfUL9fpL5sC&pg=PA220|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=2 June 2003|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=978-0-521-01262-1|page=220}} It was speculated that Boyer was forced to resign due to his clash with Deputy Prime Minister [[Alfonso Guerra]].{{cite news|author=Edward Schumacher|title=Spain's leader drops top aides in a big shuffle|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1985/07/05/world/spain-s-leader-drops-top-aides-in-a-big-shuffle.html?n=Top%2fReference%2fTimes%20Topics%2fPeople%2fG%2fGonzalez%2c%20Felipe|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=5 July 1985}} In addition, Boyer attempted to increase his power in the cabinet and demanded to assume the post of second vice prime minister, also leading to his forced resignation.{{cite book|author=Otto Holman|title=Integrating Southern Europe: EC Expansion and the Transnationalization of Spain|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=F8KUPvmJvVMC&pg=PA1965|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=6 December 2012|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-1-134-80356-9|page=1965}} Shortly after leaving office he was named as the chief executive of the Banco Exterior de Espana and next of the investment company, Cartera Central.{{cite news|author=Paul Heywood|title=Sleaze in Spain|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-17784355/sleaze-spain-sleaze-politics.html|accessdate=8 July 2013|work=Parliamentary Affairs|date=1 October 1995}} In 1986, he was named member of the Abragam committee that oversaw the future structure of the [[CERN]].{{cite book|author=Herwig F. Schopper|title=Lep: The Lord of the Collider Rings at CERN 1980-2000: The Making, Operation and Legacy of the World's Largest Scientific Instrument|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4Sysug8oMkUC&pg=PA156|accessdate=18 July 2013|date=1 January 2009|publisher=Springer|isbn=978-3-540-89301-1|page=156}} Until 1999 he served as a senior manager at the Spanish construction group FCC. From July 1999 to January 2005, he was the chairman of CLH, a Spanish fuel distribution company.{{cite news|title=Repsol YPF to replace Boyer at helm of CLH|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-18571705_ITM|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=El Pais|date=13 January 2005}} In May 2010, Boyer was appointed board member to [[Hispania Racing|the Hispania Racing Team]].{{cite web|title=Hispania forms new board of directors|url=http://www.gpupdate.net/en/f1-news/235658/hispania-forms-new-board-of-directors/|work=GP Update|accessdate=8 July 2013}} He also assumed the post of finance director and advisor to the team.{{cite news|last=Duff|first=Alex|title=Formula 1 Team Uses 175-Mile-Per-Hour Rolling Billboard to Find Sponsors|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-05-27/formula-1-team-uses-175-mile-per-hour-rolling-billboard-to-find-sponsors.html|accessdate=8 July 2013|work=Bloomberg|date=27 May 2011}} On 20 May 2010, he was also named as the independent member of the board of directors of Red Electrica Corporacion SA.{{cite news|title=Red Electrica Corporacion SA (REE.MC)|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/companyOfficers?symbol=REE.MC|accessdate=8 July 2013|work=Reuters}} In addition he served as the head of Urbis.{{cite news|title=Miguel Boyer leaves the ICU and evolves "very satisfactory"|url=http://nasdaqreportnews.com/2012/04/11/miguel-boyer-leaves-the-icu-and-evolves-very-satisfactory/|accessdate=26 September 2013|work=Nasdaq Report News|date=11 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130927113524/http://nasdaqreportnews.com/2012/04/11/miguel-boyer-leaves-the-icu-and-evolves-very-satisfactory/|archivedate=27 September 2013|df=dmy-all}} ===Controversy=== In February 1992, Boyer and Mariano Rubio, the then [[governor of the Bank of Spain]], were accused of [[fraud]] and share-price manipulation in relation to the Ibercorp.{{cite news|title=Spain's Insiders in Insider Scandal|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/05/23/business/spain-s-insiders-in-insider-scandal.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=23 May 1992}}{{cite book|author=Hayley Rabanal|title=Belén Gopegui: The Pursuit of Solidarity in Post-transition Spain|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=huSzF6KsjXcC&pg=PA85|accessdate=8 July 2013|year=2011|publisher=Boydell & Brewer Ltd|isbn=978-1-85566-233-9|page=85}} Boyer was not sentenced, but it resulted in jail sentence for Rubio. ===Views=== In the 1970s, Boyer supported self-managing socialism.{{cite book|author=Juliá Santos|title=Élites and power in twentieth-century Spain. Essays in honour of Sir Raymond Carr|year=1990|publisher=Clarendon Press|location=Oxford|url=http://www.santosjulia.com/Santos_Julia/90-94_files/The%20ideological%20conversion.pdf|editor=Lannon Frances and Preston Paul|chapter=The ideological conversion of the leaders of the PSOE, 1976-1979}} However, later he became known for his [[Orthodox economics|orthodox]], moderate and pragmatic approach to economy.{{cite book|author=John Williamson|title=The Political Economy of Policy Reform|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=cm-3mnvjEl8C&pg=PA198|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=January 1994|publisher=Peterson Institute|isbn=978-0-88132-195-1|page=198}} Despite being a member of the socialist government, he held [[neo-liberal]] views of economy when he was minister. In addition, he and his successor Carlos Solchaga did not fit into the party's projected socialist mould.{{cite book|author=Richard Gillespie|title=Mediterranean Politics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UpC4QJP66HUC&pg=PA173|accessdate=8 July 2013|year=1994|publisher=Fairleigh Dickinson Univ Press|isbn=978-0-8386-3609-1|page=173}} They both implemented economic policies based the orthodox liberal ideas, and the social outcomes of these policies were largely neglected.{{cite journal|author=Richard Gillespie|title=Factionalism in the Spanish Socialist Party|journal=Working Papers Barcelona|year=1992|issue=59|url=http://ddd.uab.cat/pub/worpap/1992/hdl_2072_1423/ICPS59.pdf|accessdate=8 July 2013}} Their priority was to reduce inflation, using steps to control the money supply, which reinforced the high levels of interest and a strong currency. Although Boyer's policy decreased the rate of inflation and government spending, Spain experienced the Europe's highest unemployment rate at about 20%.{{cite news|title=Spain's Finance Minister Quits Amid Major Cabinet Reshuffle|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1985-07-05/news/mn-9098_1_prime-minister-felipe-gonzalez|accessdate=11 July 2013|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=5 July 1985}} Boyer also encouraged the economic integration of [[Spain]] into [[the European Union]].{{cite book|author1=Richard Gillespie|author2=Fernando Rodrigo|author3=Jonathan Story|title=Democratic Spain: Reshaping External Relations in a Changing World|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=JZLFJMJ6Jx0C&pg=PA59|accessdate=8 July 2013|year=1995|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-0-415-11325-0|page=59}} ==Personal life and death== Boyer divorced his first wife, gynecologist [[Elena Arnedo]], to wed a socialite, [[Isabel Preysler]], in 1987.{{cite news|author=Robby Tantingco|title=The Kapampangan girl Julio Iglesias loved before|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/pampanga/opinion/2012/12/10/tantingco-kapampangan-girl-julio-iglesias-loved-257683|work=Sun Star|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=10 December 2012}} She was the former spouse of the singer [[Julio Iglesias]] and the Marquis of Grinon, Carlos Falco.{{cite web|title=The Beautiful Women of the Philippines|url=http://www.angelfire.com/trek/richplayaaa/beautiful/newisabelpreysler.html|work=Angelfire|accessdate=8 July 2013}} They had a daughter, Ana Boyer. Boyer had also two sons and a daughter with his first wife.{{cite news|title=Ex-economy minister Miguel Boyer dies in hospital|url=http://news.gnom.es/news/ex-economy-minister-miguel-boyer-dies-in-hospital|accessdate=29 September 2014|work=Gnomes|date=29 September 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006140344/http://news.gnom.es/news/ex-economy-minister-miguel-boyer-dies-in-hospital|archivedate=6 October 2014|df=dmy-all}} Boyer died of a [[pulmonary embolism]] after being admitted to the Ruber International Hospital in Madrid on 29 September 2014.{{cite news|title=Mor als 75 anys l'exministre socialista Miguel Boyer per una embòlia pulmonar|url=http://www.324.cat/noticia/2494357/politica/Mor-lexministre-socialista-Miguel-Boyer-per-una-embolia-pulmonar|accessdate=29 September 2014|work=324|date=29 September 2014}}{{cite web|title=Miguel Boyer Dies at 75 Years Old in Madrid|url=http://www.gettyimages.co.uk/detail/news-photo/general-view-of-ruber-international-hospital-following-the-news-photo/456326354|publisher=Getty Images|accessdate=29 September 2014}} He was 75. ==References== {{Reflist|33em}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Boyer, Miguel}} [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:2014 deaths]] [[Category:Complutense University of Madrid alumni]] [[Category:Government ministers of Spain]] [[Category:Members of the first Congress of Deputies (Spain)]] [[Category:Politicians from Madrid]] [[Category:Spanish businesspeople]] [[Category:Spanish economists]] [[Category:Spanish Socialist Workers' Party politicians]] [[Category:Spanish socialites]] [[Category:Spanish people of French descent]]

{{Orphan|date=September 2018}}
'''Multi-Modal Logistics Parks (MMLPs)''' are a key policy initiative of the [[Government of India]] to improve the country’s logistics sector by lowering overall freight costs, reducing vehicular pollution and congestion, and cutting warehousing costs. The government’s [[Ministry of Road Transport and Highways]] (MoRTH) is developing multi-modal logistics parks at selected locations in the country under its Logistics Efficiency Enhancement Program (LEEP).<ref>IANS. 2017. Government to develop 15 multi-modal logistics parks for Rs 33,000 cr. Business Standard. 16 May. <nowiki>https://www.business-standard.com/article/economy-policy/government-to-develop-15-multi-modal-logistics-parks-for-rs-33-000-cr-117051501161_1.html</nowiki></ref> India is burdened with high logistics costs, which account for about 13% of the value of goods sold in the economy compared with 8% in other major economies. The average cost to export/import one container in India is about 72% higher than in China.<ref name=":0">R. Arora. 2017. Government Approves Plan to Build 34 Mega Multi-Modal Logistics Parks at an Investment of Rs2 Lakh Cr. The Economic Times. 21 July. <nowiki>https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/infrastructure/government-approves-plan-to-build-34-mega-multi-modal-logistics-parks-at-an-investment-of-rs-2-lakh-cr/articleshow/59690653.cms</nowiki></ref>
LEEP, which is spearheaded by the MoRTH and the [[National Highways Authority of India]] (NHAI), aims to enhance freight transport in India by reducing costs and time, and improving the tracking and traceability of consignments through infrastructural, procedural, and information technology interventions.<ref name=":1">Government of India, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways. 2016. Logistics Efficiency Enhancement Program (LEEP). Delhi.</ref>
The government defines an MMLP as a freight-handling facility encompassing a minimum area of 100 acres (40.5 hectares), with various modes of transport access, and comprising mechanized warehouses, specialized storage solutions such as cold storage, facilities for mechanized material handling and inter-modal transfer container terminals, and bulk and break-bulk cargo terminals.<ref>Government of India, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways. 2017. Draft Policy Document: Development of Multimodal Logistics Parks. Delhi.</ref> Logistics parks will further provide value-added services such as customs clearance with bonded storage yards, quarantine zones, testing facilities, and warehousing management services. Provisions will also be made for late-stage manufacturing activities such as kitting and final assembly, grading, sorting, labelling and packaging activities, re-working, and returns management (Arora, 2017).
== Background == Keeping pace with India’s rapid economic growth is the expansion of the country’s logistics sector. The movement of freight in the country nearly doubled to around 2,300 billion ton-kilometers in fiscal year 2015 from 1,200 billion ton-kilometers in fiscal year 2008.<ref>A ton-kilometer is a unit of transport measurement equivalent to moving 1 ton of cargo a distance of 1 kilometer.</ref> The government expects freight movement in the country to continue its growth trajectory, with expected annual growth of 8%–10% over the next 10 years. The logistics sector as a whole, according to a study commissioned by MoRTH, is poised to expand at roughly 1.2 times the rate of India’s gross domestic product growth through 2032, by which time it is expected to generate $360 billion in value added, up from $115 billion in 2017.<ref>H.Y. Jeong. 2017. What Multimodal Parks Can Do for Logistics in India. 27 September. <nowiki>https://blogs.adb.org/blog/what-multimodal-parks-can-do-logistics-india</nowiki></ref>
In 2016, India managed to improve its performance in the [[Logistics Performance Index]] (LPI), a ranking published by the [[World Bank]] to measure the logistics performance of countries.<ref>The World Bank. 2016. Connecting to Compete 2016: Trade Logistics in the Global Economy—The Logistics Performance Index and Its Indicators. Washington: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank.</ref> India’s LPI ranking rose to 35th in 2016, up from 46th in 2012. India’s ranking, however, still lags behind some of its economic peers, including other Asian countries. The best logistics performer in Asia is Singapore, which was ranked 5th in 2016, followed by Hong Kong, China (9th); Japan (12th); the Republic of Korea (24th); and the People’s Republic of China (PRC) (27th). Among the grouping of so-called [[BRICS]]—comprising Brazil, Russia, India, the PRC, and South Africa—aside from the PRC, South Africa also outperformed India in 2016 with a ranking of 20th (World Bank, 2016).
However, there remain significant challenges to the sector’s development. Logistics costs are high in India relative to costs in developed countries. Logistics costs as a percentage of gross domestic product stood at approximately 13% in 2015. In comparison, the logistics cost in developed countries is approximately 8%–10%. In more specific terms, India’s road freight cost per ton-kilometer, adjusted for purchasing power parity, is ₹1.90 ($0.03), which is almost double that of the United States.<ref>Government of India, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways. 2017. Concept Note: Logistics Efficiency Enhancement Program (LEEP)—Development of Multimodal Logistics Parks. Delhi.</ref>
Higher logistics costs in India are primarily driven by five key factors.<ref name=":1" /> One is an unfavorable inter-modal mix, with 60% of freight movement skewed toward road transport despite the lower freight cost of rail transport. Second is India’s inefficient fleet mix, which is characterized by smaller, inefficient trucks. Third is the underdeveloped material handling infrastructure that is characterized by a fragmented industry consisting largely of small, unorganized warehouses with limited mechanization. Fourth is the underdeveloped road infrastructure with a limited presence of 4- and 6-lane national highways. Lastly, the lack of a national logistics policy, institutional and regulatory bottlenecks, such as complicated documentation and procedures related to toll collections, adversely impact logistics costs in India.<ref name=":1" />
== Government policy initiatives == Along with its initial efforts, including the [[Make in India]] program and improvements in infrastructure, Government of India has made a number of decisions aimed at transforming the country’s logistics sector. According to R. Goyal and S. Singh, adviser and young professional in the infrastructure–connectivity vertical section of [[NITI Aayog]], the government is committed towards an integrated development of logistics sector through policy amendments, infrastructural development, tax reforms and technology adoption.<ref>R. Goyal and S. Singh. 2018. Indian Logistics Sector: On the Path of Transformation. Government of India, NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India). <nowiki>http://niti.gov.in/content/indian-logistics-sector-path-transformation</nowiki></ref>
These decisions include the nationwide imposition of a goods and services tax (GST), which came into effect 1 July 2017. This levy on the supply of goods and services, which replaced many indirect tax laws that previously existed in India, should expedite the conversion of informal logistics operations into formal ones and speed up freight movement at interstate borders as check posts are dismantled. The government further established a new logistics division in the Department of Commerce to coordinate integrated development of the sector via policy changes, improvement in existing procedures, identification of bottlenecks and gaps, and introduction of technology-based interventions. The [[Ministry of Commerce and Industry (India)|Ministry of Commerce and Industry]] is aiming to develop an integrated logistics portal to connect buyers, logistics service providers and relevant government agencies. The logistics sector has been reclassified by the government with its inclusion under the Harmonized Master List of Infrastructure Subsector. With this, the logistics sector can access long-term credit, the approval process for the construction of MMLPs is simplified, and investments by debt and pension funds into recognized logistics projects would be encouraged by the regulated sector’s market accountability (Goyal & Singh, 2018).
== Purpose and design == The development of MMLPs is envisaged as a key policy measure to reduce logistics costs and help address three of the five constraining issues identified above. Specifically, these include an unfavorable modal mix, inefficient fleet mix, and underdeveloped material handling infrastructure. In July 2017, the Government of India approved a plan to build 35 MMLPs. State governments will provide the land needed for the projects, which will then be taken up through public–private partnerships.<ref name=":0" />
According to MoRTH, these MMLPs are expected to serve five key functions: freight aggregation and distribution, multi-modal freight transport, integrated storage and warehousing, information technology support, and value-added services. [[File:The_Effective_Framework_for_a_Multi-Modal_Logistics_Park_Development.jpg|alt=|center|frameless|600x600px]]
== ADB role and support == In 2017, the Government of India launched a program to develop 35 multi-modal logistics parks across the country over the succeeding years and invited [[Asian Development Bank]] (ADB) to become a lead partner and provide the necessary support (Jeong, 2017). ADB then conducted a pre-feasibility study to assess the suitability of MMLP locations and identify the requisite infrastructure, connectivity, and regulatory reforms in two selected locations: [[Bangalore|Bengaluru]] in Karnataka and [[Guwahati]] in Assam.
In this regard, the state government identified Dabaspete as the site for the park for Bengaluru in Karnataka. Bengaluru is ideally located for an MMLP in south India, with good connections via rail and road networks, and proximity to 17 million potential consumers in Chennai. ADB sees the Bengaluru MMLP as having the potential to become a model for other multimodal logistics parks in India. ADB also supported the pre-feasibility study for a MMLP in [[Jogighopa]], Assam, which incorporates rail, road, and inland-waterway connectivity. The proposed site is located along [[National Waterway 2]] and on the Indo-Bangladesh road route, making it suitable for the MMLP with multi modal access.<ref>K. Rathi. 2018. Multimodal logistics park: Re-defining infrastructure in India. Qrius.com (formerly The Indian Economist). 21 February. <nowiki>https://qrius.com/multimodal-logistics-park-redefining-infrastructure-india/</nowiki></ref>

[[File:Sri Mariamman Temple 2.JPG|thumb|200px|The present [[gopuram]] of the [[Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore|Sri Mariamman Temple]] was built in 1925, replacing an earlier tower. Although the temple, as an institution, was founded on its present site by Pillay in 1827, little remains of the original structure he built.]]
'''Narayana Pillai''' was a social entrepreneur and businessman, who spent most of his life in Singapore during the [[Colonialism|colonial period]]. Of [[Tamil films|Tamil]] origins, he greatly contributed to the Tamil community in Singapore.
Prior to 1819, Pillai (also spelled Narayana Pillay) worked in [[Penang]], which was ruled by the [[United Kingdom|British]]. There, he came into contact with [[Stamford Raffles]], a senior official of the [[British East India Company]], who was keen to establish a new trading post at the southern end of the [[Straits of Malacca]]. This resulted in the [[founding of modern Singapore]] in 1819. In Penang, Raffles persuaded Pillai to join him and to work at his new settlement.<ref>{{cite web | title = Naraina (Narayana) Pillai (Pillay) | publisher = [[National Library Board]] | url = http://infopedia.nlb.gov.sg/articles/SIP_771_2004-12-29.html | accessdate = 2008-01-13 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080109033611/http://infopedia.nlb.gov.sg/articles/SIP_771_2004-12-29.html | archivedate = 2008-01-09 | df = }}</ref>
== Early life ==
=== Arrival in Singapore === Pillai arrived in Singapore with Raffles in 1819 on the ship ‘Indiana’, making him one of the first Tamil men to set foot there. He started his career there as the chief clerk at the government [[Treasury]], where he verified the authenticity of [[currency]]. However, he soon moved on to become a successful entrepreneur and community leader in his own right.
== Businesses == With the establishment of a modern urban settlement at Singapore, Pillai noticed a boom in building works. He wrote to his contact in Penang to send [[bricklayer]]s, [[carpenter]]s and cloth merchants to Singapore. He then established the island’s first [[brick]] [[kiln]] at what is now [[Tanjong Pagar]]. Through these efforts, he also became Singapore’s first [[general contractor|building contractor]].
Pillai also ventured into the [[cotton]] goods trade. He sold these at Cross Street. In time, his shop became the largest and best known in town. However, a fire in 1822 destroyed his business, leaving him in debt to British merchants who had let him large volumes of cloth on [[credit (finance)|credit]]. Pillai struggled to negotiate with his creditors, and also secured help from Raffles when the latter returned to visit Singapore. At land he obtained in Commercial Square (now [[Raffles Place]]), he erected new warehouses and rebuilt his business from scratch, eventually paying off his debts and remaking his wealth.
== Contributions == Apart from his success in business, Pillai is best remembered for his social contributions. He was keen to build a temple on the island to serve the growing [[Hindu]] population there. After some difficulty in obtaining a suitable site, he was able to acquire land at [[South Bridge Road]] for the purpose in 1823. Here, he erected the [[Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore|Sri Mariamman Temple]] in 1827,<ref>{{cite web | title = Sri Mariamman Temple (A National Monument) | publisher = [[National Heritage Board (Singapore)|National Heritage Board]] | url = http://www.nhb.gov.sg/PE/FOF_2003/sites_srimariamman.html | accessdate = 2008-01-13 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071221083919/http://www.nhb.gov.sg/PE/FOF_2003/sites_srimariamman.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-12-21}}</ref> which endures today as the oldest Hindu place of worship on the island, and one of the [[National Monuments of Singapore]]. Pillai also envisioned a Hindu Institute for young boys, but this did not materialize. Nevertheless, Pillai’s standing led to his appointment by the British as the chief of the Indian population, which conferred on him powers to settle disputes within the community.
== Awards == Pillay gained recognition as a leader amongst the [[Tamil people|Tamils]] and was appointed chief of Indians from Cholamandalaman, given the authority to settle disputes amongst the [[Tamils]].

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2017}} '''Nathan David Saatchi''' (24 December 1907 - 2000) was an Iraqi-born British businessman, a textile merchant who moved from [[Baghdad]] to [[London]].<ref name="telegraph1">{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/1343766/Nathan-Saatchi.html |title=Nathan Saatchi |publisher=Telegraph |date=19 June 2000 |accessdate=27 April 2017}}</ref>
Nathan Saatchi was born into a middle-class Jewish family on 24 December 1907 in Iraq.<ref name="telegraph1"/>
In 1936, he married Daisy Ezair, and they had four sons, including [[Maurice Saatchi]] and [[Charles Saatchi]].<ref name="telegraph1"/>

{{refimprove|date=August 2008}} '''Offshore outsourcing''' is the practice of hiring an external organization to perform some business functions ("[[Outsourcing]]") in a country other than the one where the [[Product (business)|products]] or [[Service (economics)|services]] are actually developed or manufactured ("[[:wikt:Offshore|Offshore]]"). It can be contrasted with [[offshoring]], in which a company moves itself entirely to another country, or where functions are performed in a foreign country by a foreign subsidiary. Opponents point out that the practice of sending work overseas by countries with higher [[wage]]s reduces their own domestic employment and domestic investment. Many customer service jobs as well as jobs in the [[information technology]] sectors ([[data processing]], [[computer programming]], and [[technical support]]) in countries such as the [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]] - have been or are potentially affected.
==Types== There are four basic types of offshore outsourcing: * [[Information technology outsourcing]] (ITO) is where outsourcing related to technology or internet such as computer programming. * [[Business process outsourcing]] (BPO) involves contracting out of operational functions to a third party service provider. * [[Offshore software R&D|Offshore software development]] * [[Knowledge process outsourcing]] (KPO) is a type of outsourcing which involves or requires a more advanced technical skill and a higher level of expertise.
==Criteria== The general criteria for a job to be offshore-able are: * There is a significant wage difference between the original and offshore countries; * The job can be [[telework]]; * The work has a {{clarify|text=high information content|date=November 2015}}; * The work can be transmitted over the [[Internet]]; * The work is {{clarify|text=easy to set up|date=November 2015}}; * {{cnspan|text=The work is repeatable|date=November 2015}}.
The driving factor behind the development of offshore outsourcing has been the need to cut costs while the enabling factor has been the global electronic internet network that allows digital data to be accessed and delivered instantly, from and to almost anywhere in the world.
==Countries involved== Some of the major countries/districts that provide such services, among many others, are:- * [[Algeria]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Argentina]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Bangladesh]] (Web & Software Programming, Game Development, IT Support, Network Solutions, Offshore Outsourcing Service) * [[Belarus]] (Programming, R&D) * [[Bolivia]] (Web & Software Programming, Game Development, IT Support, Network Solutions, Offshore Outsourcing Service) * [[Brazil]] (Web & Software Programming, Game Development, IT Support, Network Solutions, Offshore Outsourcing Service) * [[Bulgaria]] (Programming and R&D) * [[Colombia]] (ITO, BPO, IT services, KPO) * [[Costa Rica]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[China]] (Programming, Data Entry, Customer Support, F&A) *[[Dominican Republic]](Customer Service,Manufacturing) * [[Egypt]] (ITO, BPO, and KPO) * [[Estonia]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[India]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Indonesia]] (Programming, R&D, IT Support, Data Entry, Customer Support) * [[Malaysia]] (Customer Support and R&D) * [[Mauritius]] (ITO and BPO) * [[Mexico]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Morocco]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Nepal]] (Programming, Customer Support, Transcription and Data Entry) * [[Pakistan]] (Full Spectrum Services) * [[Panama]] (Programming, Customer Support) * [[Philippines]] (Customer Support, IT Support, Programming, Data Entry, Animation, Transcription, R&D) * [[Republic of Macedonia]] (Web Software, Mobile Software, Game Development, Network Solutions, Offshore Outsourcing Service, R&D) * [[Romania]] (Programming and IT) * [[Russia]] (Programming and R&D) * [[Ukraine]] (Programming and R&D) * [[Vietnam]] (ITO, BPO, IT services, Offshore Outsourcing Service)
==Impact of the Internet== The widespread use and availability of the Internet has enabled individuals and small businesses to contract [[freelancer]]s from all over the world to get projects done at a lower [[cost]] due to lower wages and property prices. [[Crowdsourcing]] systems such as [[Amazon Mechanical Turk|Mechanical Turk]] and CrowdFlower have added the element of scalability, allowing businesses to outsource information tasks across the Internet to thousands of workers.
This trend runs in parallel with the tendency towards outsourcing in larger corporations, and may serve to strengthen [[small business]]' capacity to compete with their larger competitors (who are capable of setting up offshore locations) or arrive at major contracts with offshore companies.
On the other hand, according to Gartner, it also helped with accessibility to labor resources across the world, regardless of company size.<ref>Gartner Outlines the Top 10 Forces to Impact Outsourcing and IT Services Industry. Sep. 2010. http://www.gartner.com/newsroom/id/1433214</ref> It gave rise to business models such as [[Remote In-Sourcing]] that allow companies to tap into resources found abroad, without losing control over security of product quality. The resulting ability to work remotely and online, will continue to have a huge impact on the overall development of the global economy, for small companies and for large corporations.
==Source of conflict== There are different views on the impact of offshore outsourcing on the various societies affected, which reflects the attitude of [[Protectionism]] versus [[Free Trade]]. Some see it as a potential threat to the domestic job market in the developed world and ask for government protective measures (or at least closer scrutiny of existing trade practices), while others, including the countries who receive the work, see it as an opportunity. In fact, offshore outsourcing has led to Domestic factories and companies closing down leaving tens of thousands of U.S. workers jobless while underdeveloped countries such as Brazil, Turkey, etc. begin to flourish.<ref>Kupchan, C. (2012, January 1). The Democratic malaise: Globalization and the threat to the West, 62-67.</ref> Free-trade advocates suggest economies as a whole will obtain a net benefit from labor offshoring, but it is unclear if the displaced receive a net benefit.
Many companies offshore outsource because the wages are cheaper in other areas. This is beginning to create a conflict because many wages overseas are raising. For example, a study by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics found that Chinese wages were almost tripled in the seven years following 2002. The wage increases could change the set up of offshore outsourcing in years to come.<ref>Plunkett Research Group, https://www.plunkettresearch.com/industries/outsourcing-offshoring-bpo-market-research/ </ref>
One issue offshoring of technical services has brought more attention to is the value of education as an alleged solution to trade-related displacements. Education may no longer be a [[comparative advantage]] of high-wage nations because the cost of education may be lower in the nations involved in the controversy. [http://www.latimes.com/news/education/la-na-outsource6mar06,1,3461071.story?page=1&coll=la-news-learning&ctrack=1&cset=true] While it is true that education is usually considered helpful to competitiveness in general, an "education [[arms race]]" with low-wage nations may not pay off.

{{Eastern Slavic name|Yuryevich|Gubarev}} {{Infobox Politician |title = |name = Pavel Gubarev |birth_name = Pavel Yuryevich Gubarev |native_name = Павел Губарев |native_name_lang = ru |image = Pavel Gubarev, August 5, 2014.jpg |imagesize = 250px |office = People's Governor of the [[Donetsk People's Republic]]{{cite news|title=Demonstrators in Donetsk press for release of ‘people’s governor’|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/723778|agency=[[TASS|ITAR-TASS News Agency]]|accessdate=13 May 2018}} |caption = |term_start = 3 March 2014 |term_end = 4 November 2014 |primeminister = [[Alexander Borodai]]
[[Alexander Zakharchenko]] |successor = [[Alexander Zakharchenko]] {{small|(as President)}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|02|10|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Sievierodonetsk]],{{cite news|date=7 March 2014|url=http://vip.tyzhden.ua/Chronicle/104308|script-title=uk:Самопроголошений губернатор Донеччини Павло Губарєв: еполети, сталінізм та "еллінські традиції"|trans-title=The self-proclaimed governor of Donetsk Pavel Gubarev: epaulettes, Stalinism and "Hellenic tradition"|newspaper=[[The Ukrainian Week]]|language=uk|accessdate=13 May 2018}} [[Ukrainian SSR]], [[Soviet Union]] |death_date = |death_place = |citizenship = Ukraine |relations = |spouse = [[Ekaterina Gubareva]] |children = Two sons, one daughter |alma_mater = [[Donetsk National University|University of Donetsk]] |nationality = |occupation = |party = [[New Russia Party]] (2014–present)
[[Progressive Socialist Party of Ukraine|Progressive Socialist Party]] (before 2014)
[[Russian National Unity]]{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2014/04/east-ukraine-crisis-fascist-ma-2014416145823826439.html|title=East Ukraine crisis and the 'fascist' matrix|author=Halya Coynash|agency=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=17 April 2014}} (2002) |signature = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Pavel Yuryevich Gubarev''' ({{lang-ru|Па́вел Ю́рьевич Гу́барев}}, {{IPA-ru|ˈpavʲɪl ˈjʉrʲɪvʲɪtɕ ˈgubərʲɪf|pron}}, {{lang-uk|Павло Юрійович Губарєв}}), born 10 February 1983 in [[Sievierodonetsk]], is a Ukrainian pro-Russian activist who proclaimed himself the "People's Governor" of the [[Donetsk Oblast|Donetsk Region]] at the Regional Assembly on 3 March 2014, after separatists seized the building. Gubarev had earlier declared himself leader of the [[Donbass People's Militia]].{{cite news|date=7 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018|url=http://www.unian.net/politics/894286-sud-arestoval-gubernatora-samozvantsa-gubareva-na-dva-mesyatsa.html|title=Суд арестовал губернатора-самозванца Губарева на два месяца|trans-title=Court arrested the impostor governor Gubaryov for two months|agency=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|UNIAN]]}} But since then he has been sidelined by other separatist leaders and was banned from taking part in the [[Donbass parliamentary elections, 2014|2014 Donbass parliamentary elections]]. These elections also eliminated the post of "People's Governor". Gubarev was not a major figure in local politics prior to the beginning of the [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine]].{{citation needed|date=September 2014}} Shortly after declaring himself "People's Governor" on March 6, Gubarev was arrested by the [[Security Service of Ukraine|Security Service of Ukraine (SBU)]] for "advocating separatism" and "illegal seizure of power". He faced up to ten years in prison.{{cite news|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/afp/140309/pro-russian-gubarev-symbol-east-ukraine-separatism|title=Pro-Russian Gubarev, a symbol of east Ukraine separatism|newspaper=[[GlobalPost]]|date=10 March 2014|accessdate=10 March 2014|archivedate=11 March 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140311065542/http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/afp/140309/pro-russian-gubarev-symbol-east-ukraine-separatism|deadurl=yes|df=}} On 7 May, Gubarev was freed in exchange for [[Security Service of Ukraine|SBU]] officers detained earlier by the [[Donbass People's Militia]].{{cite news|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/730793|title=Donetsk people's governor Pavel Gubarev freed in echange for SBU officers|agency=ITAR-TASS|date=7 May 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}}{{cite news|title=Пленных сотрудников Альфы обменяли на трех лидеров сепаратистов - СБУ|url=http://www.unian.net/politics/915617-plennyih-sotrudnikov-alfyi-obmenyali-na-treh-liderov-separatistov-sbu.html|agency=UNIAN|date=7 May 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} ==Early life== Gubarev gained a degree in history from the [[Donetsk National University]], and later became an employee of a Donetsk advertising agency. In 2007 he founded and served as the company director of the [http://morozko.dn.ua/2012/o_nas_pishut/ "Morozko" company], which supplied hired [[Ded Moroz]] (Santa Claus) figures in the Donetsk area.{{cite web|language=ru|url= http://focus.ua/society/300311/|script-title=ru:Донецкий "народный губернатор" работал Дедом Морозом по вызову|trans-title=Donetsk's "national governor" worked as an on-call Santa Claus}}{{cite news|date=13 May 2014|title=Ukraine: 'People's governor' worked as Santa-for-hire|publisher=[[BBC News]]|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-news-from-elsewhere-27390108|accessdate=13 May 2018}} ==Career== Gubarev was a member of the [[Progressive Socialist Party of Ukraine]], a pro-Russian party based in the southeast of the country.{{cite news|author=Germain Moyon|url=http://digitaljournal.com/news/world/pro-russian-gubarev-a-symbol-of-east-ukraine-separatism/article/375337|title=Pro-Russian Gubarev, a symbol of east Ukraine separatism|publisher=Digital Journal|agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]|date=9 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} According to an unnamed acquaintance, Gubarev advocates [[Pan-Slavism]]. In earlier years Gubarev was a member of the neo-Nazi [[Russian National Unity]] paramilitary group.{{cite news|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/117048/crimean-referendum-was-electoral-farce|title=Far-Right Forces are Influencing Russia's Actions in Crimea|author=Snyder, Timothy|authorlink=Timothy D. Snyder|newspaper=[[The New Republic]]|date=17 March 2014|accessdate=10 April 2014|archivedate=17 March 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317211808/http://www.newrepublic.com/article/117048/crimean-referendum-was-electoral-farce|quote="In Donetsk Gubarov was known as a neo-Nazi and as a member of the fascist organization Russian National Unity."|deadurl=yes|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://iwpr.net/report-news/far-right-recruited-crimea-poll-observers|title=Far-Right Recruited as Crimea Poll Observers|last=Coynash|first=Halya|publisher=[[Institute for War and Peace Reporting]]|date=18 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018|quote="Pavel Gubarev, a former member of the neo-Nazi, Russian chauvinist Russian National Unity movement"|df=}}{{cite news|title=Russia’s deep ties to Donetsk's Kremlin collaborators|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/russias-deep-ties-to-donetsks-kremlin-collaborators-342833.html|author=Oleksiy Matsuka and Vitaliy Sizov|newspaper=Kyiv Post|date=10 April 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018|quote="In Donetsk, Pavel Gubarev, a Ukrainian citizen and former member of the Russian National Unity movement, attempted to head the protest."|df=}}{{cite news|date=10 April 2014|url=http://ru.tsn.ua/politika/rossiya-stanovitsya-nacistskoy-fashisty-ubivayut-migrantov-ne-priznayut-ukrainu-i-prizyvayut-k-diversiyam-359854.html|title=Кремлевские неонацисты консультируют сепаратистов в Украине для расширения империи|trans-title=Kremlin-oriented neo-Nazis advise separatists in Ukraine on expanding their empire|agency=[[1+1 (channel)|TSN]]|accessdate=13 May 2018|quote="It is worth noting that Gubarev was recently an activist of the Russian radical nationalist organization - Russian National Unity, which is included in the International Union of National Socialists."|df=}} Gubarev has publicly given thanks to this group for providing him with military training. In the same interview he said he was not a radical nationalist and described himself as "centre-left".{{cite web|url=http://novorossia.su/node/2466|title=Павел Губарев: Я благодарен РНЕ за военную подготовку – Новороссия|publisher=novorossia.su|accessdate=14 September 2014|archivedate=14 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714113410/http://novorossia.su/node/2466|deadurl=yes|df=}} On 1 March 2014, pro-Russian citizens at a meeting in Lenin Square in the center of Donetsk elected Gubarev as governor of the region.{{cite web|website=RBK|publisher=РосБизнесКонсалтинг|url=http://www.rbc.ru/rbcfreenews/20140306193140.shtml|script-title=ru:В Донецке задержан "народный губернатор" Губарев|date=6 March 2014|language=ru|trans-title='People's Governor' Gubaryev held in Donetsk|accessdate=13 May 2018|quote=1 марта пророссийски настроенные граждане на площади Ленина в центре Донецка избрали губернатором региона Губарева, затем они захватили здание обладминистрации. [On 1 March pro-Russian-inclined citizens on Lenin Square in the center of Donetsk elected Gubarev as governor of the region; then they seized the building of the oblast administration.]}} From the beginning of the [[2014 Crimean crisis]], Gubarev led pro-Russian protesters who blockaded and occupied the Donetsk Regional State Administration building. During a press-conference with journalists on 6 March 2014, Gubarev stated that his main goal as the self-proclaimed governor was to declare a referendum on the territorial status of [[Donetsk Oblast]], non-recognition of the new Ukrainian government, and non-recognition of Donetsk governor [[Serhiy Taruta]].{{cite news|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/politics/donetsks-self-proclaimed-separatist-governor-talks-to-journalists-gets-arrested-338638.html|author=Daryna Shevchenko|title=Donetsk's self-proclaimed separatist governor talks to journalists, gets arrested|work=[[Kyiv Post]]|date=6 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} On 6 March 2014 the [[Security Service of Ukraine]] arrested Gubarev.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/10681786/Pro-Russian-leader-arrested-in-Donetsk-as-Kiev-hits-back.html|author=Damien McElroy|title=Pro-Russian leader arrested in Donetsk as Kiev hits back|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=6 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} Following his arrest, Gubarev was reportedly taken to Kiev for detention.{{cite news|url=http://www.rferl.org/content/ukraine-activist-donetsk-detention/25288316.html|title=Pro-Russian Protest Leader In Eastern Ukraine Said Taken To Kyiv|publisher=[[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]]|date=6 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} He was later charged with wanting to damage "the territorial integrity and independence of the state".{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/03/06/us-ukraine-crisis-donetsk-idUSBREA250CW20140306|title=Ukrainian flag again flies over Donetsk regional HQ|agency=[[Reuters]]|author=Lina Kushch|date=6 March 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} On 16 March, a crowd of protesters stormed government buildings in Donetsk demanding Gubarev's release.{{cite news|title=Ukraine crisis: Pro-Russians flock to Crimea vote|accessdate=13 May 2018|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-26598832|publisher=BBC News|date=16 March 2014}} On 7 May 2014 Gubarev and two other pro-Russian activists were freed in exchange for [[Security Service of Ukraine|SBU]] officers, detained earlier by the [[Donbass People's Militia]]. In October 2014, during a failed assassination attempt on him, Gubarev lost control of his car when it came under gunfire and suffered a head injury.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-29593949|title=East Ukraine rebel leader Gubarev unconscious after ambush|publisher=BBC News|date=13 October 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} He later regained consciousness and was moved from intensive care to the ordinary ward of the hospital.{{cite news|url=http://novorossia.today/novorossia-news/yekaterina-gubareva-writes-on-pavel-guba.html|title=Yekaterina Gubareva writes on Pavel Gubarev’s page in Facebook|agency=Novorossia News Agency|date=14 October 2014|accessdate=14 October 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141105014517/http://novorossia.today/novorossia-news/yekaterina-gubareva-writes-on-pavel-guba.html|archivedate=5 November 2014|deadurl=yes|df=}} Gubarev was excluded by the election commission from participating in the [[Donbass parliamentary elections, 2014|2014 Donbass parliamentary elections]] "because his party was not able to hold a founding conference".{{cite news|language=ru|url=http://www.mk.ru/politics/2014/10/30/dadut-li-novorossii-sdelat-vybor.html|script-title=ru:Дадут ли Новороссии сделать выбор?|trans-title=Will Novorossia be given a choice?|newspaper=[[Moskovskij Komsomolets]]|date=31 October 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}}
{{cite news|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/a-prelude-to-a-farce-prearranged-ballots-for-kremlin-backed-breakaway-regions-370349.html|title=A prelude to a farce: Prearranged ballots for Kremlin-backed breakaway regions|author=Oleg Sukhov|work=[[Kyiv Post]]|date=1 November 2014|accessdate=13 May 2018}} Early February 2016 Gubarev was appointed [[Yasynuvata Raion]] mayor by the [[Donetsk People's Republic]].{{cite news|url=http://www.neweasterneurope.eu/articles-and-commentary/1910-ukraine-s-eastern-separatist-leaders-turn-on-each-other|title=Ukraine’s eastern separatist leaders turn on each other|publisher=[[New Eastern Europe]]|date=3 March 2016|archivedate=4 March 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304100719/http://www.neweasterneurope.eu/articles-and-commentary/1910-ukraine-s-eastern-separatist-leaders-turn-on-each-other|deadurl=yes|df=}} Following the death of [[Alexander Zakharchenko]], there will be so-called "elections" in the Donetsk People's Republic on 11 November 2018.{{cite|url=https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2018/09/7/7191378/ |title=Боевики на Донбассе назначили "выборы" |trans-title=Militants in the Donbass call "elections" |date=7 September 2018 |newspaper=Ukrayinska Pravda}} In September 2018, Pavel Gubarev went to Moscow and obtained permission to be a candidate for the post of head of the Donetsk People's Republic.{{cite|url=http://ukrainianweek.com/Politics/220836 |title=The danger of wanting to be boss, What to expect from "elections" in Donetsk and Luhansk |first1=Denys |last1=Kazanskyi |date=8 October 2018 |access-date=10 October 2018 |newspaper=The Ukrainian Week}} Gubarev and supporters collected 15,000 signatures for his nomination papers{{cite|url=https://lenta.ru/news/2018/10/05/gubarev/ |title=Бывшего «народного губернатора» Донбасса не пустили на выборы |trans-title=The former "people's governor" of Donbass was not allowed to stand in elections |date=5 October 2018|newspaper=Lenta.ru}} (the law only requires 10,000 signatures). Gubarev's candidacy displeased [[Denis Pushilin]], who has taken over as head of the Donetsk People's Republic, and pressure has been put on Gubarev. On 29 September 2018, Gubarev's wife, Ekaterina, was arrested and temporarily detained to prevent her attending the [[Free Donbass]] party convention so that she was excluded from the party list for the "elections" of the [[People's Soviet of the Donetsk People's Republic]] on 11 November. At the convention, the Free Donbass movement was taken over by supporters of [[Denis Pushilin]]. After this incident Ekaterina Gubareva left for Rostov-on-Don. In early October 2018, the electoral commission ruled that the signatures on Gubarev's nomination papers were invalid;{{cite|url=https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2018/10/6/7194325/ |title=Боевики ОРДО не пустили на "выборы" своего "народного губернатора" |trans-title=ORDO Militants disallowed the "election" of their "people's governor" |date= 6 October 2018 |newspaper=Ukrayinska Pravda}} the authorities in Russia often use this method to exclude candidates. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{Twitter}} *{{VK user|pgubarev|Pavel Gubarev}} {{2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gubarev, Pavel}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Sievierodonetsk]] [[Category:Progressive Socialist Party of Ukraine politicians]] [[Category:Ukrainian businesspeople]] [[Category:Pro-Russian people of the 2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine]] [[Category:Prisoners and detainees of Ukraine]] [[Category:Russian nationalists]] [[Category:People of the Donetsk People's Republic]] [[Category:Donetsk National University alumni]] [[Category:Pro-Russian people of the war in Donbass]] [[Category:People of Antimaidan]]

{{distinguish|Playboy Mansion}} {{More citations needed|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox video game |title=Playboy: The Mansion | image = Playboy - The Mansion Coverart.png | caption = North American cover art | developer = [[Cyberlore Studios]] | publisher = [[Arush Entertainment]]
[[Groove Games]]
{{vgrelease|PAL|[[Ubisoft]]}} | director = Seth Spaulding | producer = Eric Marcoullier | designer = [[Brenda Brathwaite]] | programmer = William McFadden | artist = Seth Spaulding | engine = [[Gamebryo]] | released = {{vgrelease|NA|January 25, 2005}}{{vgrelease|PAL|March 4, 2005}} | genre = [[Business simulation game]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single player]] | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 2]], [[Xbox (console)|Xbox]] }} '''''Playboy: The Mansion''''' is a [[simulation game|simulation]] [[video game]] for the [[PlayStation 2]], [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Xbox (console)|Xbox]] consoles, developed by [[Cyberlore Studios]], published by [[Groove Games]] and [[Arush Entertainment]] and licensed by [[Playboy Enterprises]]. ==Gameplay== ''Playboy: The Mansion'' puts players in the role of [[Hugh Hefner]], the founder of ''[[Playboy]]'' Magazine and [[Playboy Enterprises]], referred to in the game as 'Hef'. The aim of the game is to build the famed Playboy Empire from scratch, starting from a humble magazine to celebrity endorsements to home entertainment to Internet websites to merchandise. The player can mold the famed [[Playboy Mansion]] to their own needs and wants, and has the option of experiencing the infamous ''Playboy'' [[Playboy Playmate|Playmate]] parties in locations such as the Grotto and the Clubhouse. Hef, as well as all other characters in the game, can build three types of relationships with other characters: casual, business, and romantic. Each month, the player has to print an issue of the magazine. To do that the player needs a cover shoot, a centerfold, an essay from a celebrity, interview with a celebrity, a pictorial about a subject and an article about a subject. The player must hire photographers and writers to create each issue. All the characters have interests, such as sports and music, and writers on those topics will produce higher-quality articles. In the game, the player is the photographer during photo shoots. The game contains many sexual references, including sexual relationships. There are twelve missions in total. Some of the goals include making and/or fixing relationships with people, publishing certain magazine content, and throwing parties. Players can also choose not to achieve goals, as there is no time limit, and do other things such as parties, mansion renovations and playing with the mansion's variety of games; however, magazines must continue to be published as that is the player's income source. ==Music== {{Main|Playboy: The Mansion Soundtrack}} The main song on the video game is playboy mansion by Prince Charming..from the album songs for my therapist A soundtrack to the game, mixed by [[United States|American]] [[Disc Jockey|DJ]] and [[record producer]] [[Felix da Housecat]] has been released. It features house tracks by many renowned producers like [[Armand Van Helden]], [[DJ Sneak]] or [[Kaskade]]. ==Expansion pack== ''Playboy: The Mansion - Private Party Expansion Pack'' is the expansion pack. It adds extra features such as parties like [[Playboy Mansion#Midsummer Night's Dream Party|Midsummer Night's Dream]], world-famous celebrities and [[Playboy Playmate|Playmate]]s, new animations, enhanced character editing and party-themed music. ===Features=== The expansion adds many new features to the game. When characters engage in sexual activities, they now remove their underwear and their [[Sex organ#Genitals|genitals]] are blurred, much like ''[[The Sims]]'' characters. Another feature is the ability to throw "theme parties", which consist of Halloween, A Midsummer Night's Dream, Hef's Birthday, Tropical, Playmate of the Year and more. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = (Xbox) 62.14%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox/920473-playboy-the-mansion/index.html|title=Playboy: The Mansion for Xbox|publisher=GameRankings|accessdate=2014-01-19}}
(PC) 60%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/914992-playboy-the-mansion/index.html|title=Playboy: The Mansion for PC|publisher=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=2014-01-19}}
(PS2) 59.97%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps2/920481-playboy-the-mansion/index.html|title=Playboy: The Mansion for PlayStation 2|publisher=GameRankings|accessdate=2014-01-19}} | MC = (Xbox) 61/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox/playboy-the-mansion/critic-reviews|title=Playboy: The Mansion Critic Reviews for Xbox|publisher=Metacritic|accessdate=2014-01-19}}
